page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT
page.content: AS A RESULT OF QUESTIONAIRE ON EMPLOYMENT SENT TO EACH FAMILY WITH SCHOOL CHILDREN,WE FOUND THAT 90% OF FAMILIES IN THE DISTRICT WORK MORE THAN THREE MILES AWAY FROM THEIR HOMES. PUBLIC TRANSPORT IS NOT VERY GOOD AND EXPENSIVE, SO THE VAST MAJORITY, 94%, TRAVEL TO WORK BY PRIVATE TRANSPORT: 89% BY CAR 4% BY MOTOR BIKE 1% BY BICYCLE FEW PEOPLE NOW WORK NOW WORK IN THE TRADITIONAL COUNTRY OCCUPATIONS OF FARMING. THE JOBS PEOPLE DO ARE VARIED BUT MOST OF THEM ARE IN NORWICH , TO WHERE PEOPLE MUST COMMUTE. 75% OF FAMILIES SURVEYED HAD TWO OR MORE WAGE EARNERS ABOVE THE AGE OF 18.IN MOST CASES DAD AND MUM BOTH WORK, AND OUTSIDE THE LOCAL AREA.
